thread.title: State Department employees sign dissent memo on travel ban | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: State Department employees sign dissent memo on travel ban | Daily Mail Online

title: State Department employees sign dissent memo on travel ban | Daily Mail Online
text: show ad List of State Department employees upset over Trump's travel ban reaches 1,000 after Spicer said the first 100 should 'get with the program' or quit Now 1,000 State Department employees are harboring anger about President Donald Trump's travel ban and have signed a memo venting their anger The first 100 were welcome to find a new place to work, the White House declared this week 'They should either get with the program or they can go,' White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer said of diplomats signing the dissent memo Draft of the dissent cable says Trump's extreme vetting order will 'immediately' sour relations with the countries affected and 'much of the Muslim world' Spicer said Trump has been clear about his agenda and 'if somebody has a problem ... that does call into question whether or not they should continue' Published: 13:07 GMT, 1 February 2017 | Updated: 17:05 GMT, 1 February 2017 193 shares
